etymology.description: 力(力) (lì, "strength") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = applying strength vocally -> add
etymology.interpretation: The character 加(加) (jiā, "add") shows the idea of using strength in a vocal or pronounced way, suggesting an emphasis or increase, which aligns with the meaning of 'to add.'

examples.chinese: 厨师在汤里加盐(廚師在湯裡加鹽)，让味道更浓(讓味道更濃)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī zài tāng lǐ jiā yán, ràng wèidào gèng nóng.
examples.english: The chef adds salt to the soup, making the flavor richer.

examples.chinese: 他总是加一点努力(他總是加一點努力)，来克服困难(來克服困難)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì jiā yīdiǎn nǔlì, lái kèfú kùnnán.
examples.english: He always adds a bit more effort to overcome difficulties.
